newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Gensec buys stake in computer firm.
newsitem.headline: Gensec buys stake in computer firm.

text.p: Genbel Securities Ltd said on Thursday that it has bought a 45 percent stake in CS Computer Services for an undisclosed sum.

The acquired firm, which was a computer services division of accountants Coopers & Lybrand before a management buy-out nine months ago, wants to list on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange in two to three years time.
Gensec also said CS Computer Sevices expected to increase its revenues to more than 40 million rand in the next year.
"CS Computer Servics has tremendous growth potential," said Gensec general manager Steve Muller.
The firm's main operations are in the consulting and training markets.
CS Computer Services managing director Annette van der Laan said the firm had attracted numerous offers from listed firms interested in buying a stake before it accepted the offer from Gensec.
